title: TikTokers raise over $1 million for trans healthcare and gender-affirming surgeries
description: Two TikTok creators collected over $1 million for trans health care through a 30-hour “TikTok-a-Thon" fundraiser to celebrate Transgender Day of Visibility.

title: Fetterman discharged from hospital after treatment for clinical depression
description: Sen. John Fetterman was discharged from Walter Reed National Military Medical Center, where he had been receiving treatment for clinical depression since February.

title: The Gwyneth Paltrow trial is over, but the internet isn't done with it
description: A day after the verdict for the Gwyneth Paltrow and Terry Sanderson trial was delivered, the internet is still talking about its viral moments.

title: Some of Twitter's top users aren’t afraid of losing their blue check marks
description: On April Fool’s Day, Twitter says it will get rid of verification badges for nonpaying users. Check marks will be available for Twitter Blue subscribers.

title: In a loss for Fox News, judge allows Dominion's defamation case to go to trial
description: A judge denied granting summary judgment to Fox News in its attempt to get Dominion Voting System's $1.6 billion defamation lawsuit thrown out Friday.

title: China’s chip industry will be ‘reborn’ under U.S. sanctions, Huawei says
description: China’s chip industry will be “reborn” as a result of U.S. sanctions, a top boss at Huawei said Friday, as the Chinese telecommunications giant confirmed a breakthrough in semiconductor design technology.

title: 106-year-old Indigenous Filipino tattoo artist becomes Vogue cover model
description: Vogue Philippines released its April issue on Friday and its newest cover model is an 106-year-old indigenous Kalinga woman, Apo Whang-Od, also known as Maria Oggay.

title: Parts of Midwest under tornado watch as major storm system approaches central and south U.S.
description: A dangerous day is ahead for 51 million people from northern Iowa all the way down to Louisiana where large hail, damaging winds and tornadoes are all possible Friday afternoon and into the overnight.

title: Heather McDonald’s on-stage collapse became anti-vaccine fodder, but she’s alive and joking
description: Heather McDonald, like a half-dozen other people featured in the trailer for the anti-vaccine film "Died Suddenly," did not die as a result of the Covid-19 vaccine.

title: Who are the key players in the Trump hush money case and indictment?
description: All the players you need to know in Trump’s hush money case, including Alvin Bragg, Robert Costello, Karen McDougal, Stormy Daniels, Michael Cohen, and more...

title: Checked out: Twitter prepares to cut verification for those who won’t pay
description: Twitter is set to begin removing check marks from verified users who refuse to pay for the platform’s subscription service.

title: 12 trailblazers to celebrate on Transgender Day of Visibility
description: From pioneering lawmakers to history-making entertainers, here are just some of the many transgender people who have blazed trails for the community.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene calls for protests in New York after Trump indictment
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., one of Donald Trump’s closest allies on Capitol Hill, called for protests after Trump's indictment.

title: Ohio residents face hurdles and confusion as they try to claim money promised after the train derailment
description: When residents of East Palestine tried to get reimbursed for evacuation costs after a Norfolk Southern train derailed, some found the process frustratingly hard.

title: Trump faces about 30 counts in New York grand jury indictment
description: Donald Trump is facing about 30 document fraud-related charges in New York City after a grand jury voted Thursday to indict the former president, two sources familiar with the matter told NBC News.

title: Victim lost $50k after Texas DPS unknowingly sent 4,800 Asians' driver's licenses to crime group, she said
description: After the Texas Department of Public Safety revealed to victims this month that it had unknowingly sent thousands of driver’s licenses, most of which belonged to Asian Americans, to an organized crime group, a victim is sharing details of credit card fraud, stolen data, digital SIM card access and more.

title: Biden silent on Trump's indictment as he plots 20-state tour to talk jobs
description: Donald Trump’s legal woes just grew exponentially worse and Joe Biden is going to just keep running for president.

title: Trump indicted: What's next in the legal process
description: Former President Donald Trump has been indicted by a Manhattan grand jury.

title: 5 things to look for when the Trump indictment is unsealed
description: What to look for in the Trump indictment and how to read the legal documents.

title: How to regulate in the age of A.I.
description: Some tech leaders are calling for a pause on A.I. hoping that regulations will catch up with the advanced technology. NBC’s Gadi Schwartz sat down with the chatbot ChatGPT and asked if the tool could regulate itself.

title: 2024 Republican presidential rivals jump to Trump's defense after indictment
description: Donald Trump’s rivals for the Republican presidential nomination in 2024 jumped to his defense after he was indicted by a grand jury in Manhattan.

title: At the heart of Trump's indictment, an unprecedented test of American ideals
description: In becoming the first former president ever indicted, Donald Trump cemented the term that has defined his time at the center of U.S. politics: unprecedented.
